item.title: Using Redis with Drupal 7
item.description: Installing Redis for Drupal Follow these steps to install Redis as a cache for Drupal: Install Predis under sites/all/libraries/predis. Download and install the Drupal Redis module. Configuring Redis for Drupal To configure Drupal to use Redis as a cache, append the following lines to your settings.php file with the specified changes: $conf['redis_client_interface'] = 'Predis'; $conf['redis_client_host'] = 'hostname'; $conf['redis_client_port'] = port; $conf['redis_client_password'] = 'password'; $conf['lock_inc'] = 'sites/all/modules/contrib/redis/redis.lock.inc'; $conf['cache_backends'][] = 'sites/all/modules/contrib/redis/redis.

item.title: Using Redis with PHP
item.description: In order to use Redis with PHP you need a PHP Redis client. In following sections, we demonstrate the use of Predis, a flexible and feature-complete Redis client library for PHP >= 5.3. Additional PHP clients for Redis can be found under the PHP section of the Redis Clients page. Installing Predis Predis’ installation instructions are given in the “How to Use Predis” section of its README file. The recommended method for installing Predis is to use Composer and install it from Packagist or the dedicated PEAR channel.

item.title: Using Redis with Python
item.description: In order to use Redis with Python you need a Python Redis client. In following sections, we demonstrate the use of redis-py, a Redis Python Client. Additional Python clients for Redis can be found under the Python section of the Redis Clients page. Installing redis-py redis-py’s installation instructions are given in the “Installation” section of its README file. Use pip to install redis-py: sudo pip install redis You can also download the latest redis-py release from the GitHub repository.
